00037 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINTIONS ************************/
00039 #define BUFFER_SIZE                     0x40
00040 
00041 
00042 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00043 uint8_t menu1[] =
00044 "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00045 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00046 "SSP demo \n\r"
00047 "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00048 "\t - Core: ARM Cortex-M3 \n\r"
00049 "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115200bps \n\r"
00050 "\t An example of SSP using polling mode to test the SSP driver \n\r"
00051 " This example uses SSP in SPI mode as master to communicate with an SSP slave device \n\r"
00052 " The master and slave transfer together a number of data byte \n\r"
00053 "********************************************************************************\n\r";
00054 uint8_t menu2[] = "Demo terminated! \n\r";
00055 
00056 // SSP Configuration structure variable
00057 SSP_CFG_Type SSP_ConfigStruct;
00058 
00059 // Tx buffer
00060 uint8_t Tx_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00061 
00062 // Rx buffer
00063 uint8_t Rx_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00064 
00065 /************************** PRIVATE FUNCTIONS *************************/
00066 void print_menu(void);
00067 void Buffer_Init(void);
00068 void Error_Loop(void);
00069 void Buffer_Verify(void);
00070 
00071 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS------------------------------*/
00072 /*********************************************************************/
00077 void Buffer_Init(void)
00078 {
00079         uint8_t i;
00080 
00081         for (i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE; i++) {
00082                 Tx_Buf[i] = i;
00083                 Rx_Buf[i] = 0;
00084         }
00085 }
00086 
00087 /*********************************************************************/
00092 void Error_Loop(void)
00093 {
00094         /* Loop forever */
00095         while (1);
00096 }
00097 
00098 
00099 /*********************************************************************/
00104 void Buffer_Verify(void)
00105 {
00106         uint8_t i;
00107         uint8_t *src_addr = (uint8_t *) &Tx_Buf[0];
00108         uint8_t *dest_addr = (uint8_t *) &Rx_Buf[0];
00109 
00110         for ( i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE; i++ )
00111         {
00112                 if ( *src_addr++ != *dest_addr++ )
00113                 {
00114                         _DBG_("Verify error");
00115                         /* Call Error Loop */
00116                         Error_Loop();
00117                 }
00118         }
00119 }
00120 
00121 
00122 /*********************************************************************/
00127 void print_menu(void)
00128 {
00129         _DBG(menu1);
00130 }
00131 
00132 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00133 /*********************************************************************/
00138 int c_entry(void)
00139 {
00140         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00141         SSP_DATA_SETUP_Type xferConfig;
00142 
00143         /*
00144          * Initialize SPI pin connect
00145          * P0.15 - SCK;
00146          * P0.16 - SSEL
00147          * P0.17 - MISO
00148          * P0.18 - MOSI
00149          */
00150         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00151         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00152         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00153         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00154         PinCfg.Pinnum = 15;
00155         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00156         PinCfg.Pinnum = 17;
00157         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00158         PinCfg.Pinnum = 18;
00159         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00160         PinCfg.Pinnum = 16;
00161         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00162 
00163         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00164          * – 115200bps
00165          * – 8 data bit
00166          * – No parity
00167          * – 1 stop bit
00168          * – No flow control
00169          */
00170         debug_frmwrk_init();
00171 
00172         // print welcome screen
00173         print_menu();
00174 
00175         // initialize SSP configuration structure to default
00176         SSP_ConfigStructInit(&SSP_ConfigStruct);
00177         // Initialize SSP peripheral with parameter given in structure above
00178         SSP_Init(LPC_SSP0, &SSP_ConfigStruct);
00179 
00180         // Enable SSP peripheral
00181         SSP_Cmd(LPC_SSP0, ENABLE);
00182 
00183         _DBG_("Press '1' to start transfer...");
00184         while (_DG != '1');
00185 
00186         /* Initialize Buffer */
00187         _DBG_("Init buffer");
00188         Buffer_Init();
00189 
00190         _DBG_("Start transfer...");
00191 
00192         xferConfig.tx_data = Tx_Buf;
00193         xferConfig.rx_data = Rx_Buf;
00194         xferConfig.length = BUFFER_SIZE;
00195         SSP_ReadWrite(LPC_SSP0, &xferConfig, SSP_TRANSFER_POLLING);
00196 
00197         // Verify buffer after transferring
00198         Buffer_Verify();
00199         _DBG_("Verify complete!");
00200 
00201     /* Loop forever */
00202     while(1);
00203     return 1;
00204 }
00205 
00206 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00207    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00208    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00209    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00210    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00211 int main(void)
00212 {
00213     return c_entry();
00214 }
